Subject: Pupal Writers Panel
Description: You've written a bit, you've published a bit, now what?  Speakers include:Jen Haeger, Christian Klaver, Ken MacGregor, Christopher Purrett, Janice Leach - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Self-Publishing 2016
Description: This panel discusses today's self-publishing options and business models. Our panelists include authors who are both self- and traditionally published, in fiction and nonfiction, including people who are making an income entirely by self-publishing. We'll discuss why we made the choice to self-publish, the pitfalls and lessons learned, and which business choices we've made on our respective self-publishing efforts.  Speakers include:Michael W. Lucas, Jen Haeger, Christopher Purrett, Alex Kourvo, Robert Kroese - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: SF/F Madlibs
Description: Enjoy science fiction, fantasy, and pop culture Mad-libs created by our panelists. Offer up some interesting nouns, adj, verbs and adverbs and be prepared to laugh your head off!  Speakers include:Andrea Johnson, Jackie Morgan, Jen Haeger, Alex Kourvo - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Writing Fast and Slow
Description: Are you a hack if you write quickly? Are you an amateur if you write slowly? How many books a year should a working writer produce, and how has that expectation changed in today’s publishing climate? How quickly do readers want—or expect—the next book?  Speakers include:Alex Kourvo, Jen Haeger, Jim Leach, Cathrynne Valente - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Writing Workshop
Description: Join us for a hands on workshop where writers bring their pens, pencils, notepads, laptops, etc. and participate in numerous writing exercises. Exercises would likely consist of writing prompts playing with different themes, styles, voices, perspectives. A prompt is given, a time limit is set, everyone writes as much as they can or want, and then people are encouraged to read what they've written aloud. This is a chance to  to collaborate with other folks.  Speakers include:Jen Haeger, Christine Daigle, Stewart Sternberg - Track: Literature  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
